metadata.feature_description: Handles and reports crawler-specific exceptions and errors.

steps.action: Navigate to Admin > Manage > Admin Logs
steps.expected: Admin Logs page should load and display event log entries
steps.actual: Admin Logs page loaded successfully showing log entries with Date, Log Type, Username, Website, and Summary columns

steps.action: Click on the 'All Types' dropdown filter
steps.expected: Dropdown should show all available log types including exception types
steps.actual: Dropdown opened showing extensive list of log types including 'General Exception', 'Search Indexer Exception', 'Scheduler Exception', etc.

steps.expected: Log list should filter to show only General Exceptions
steps.actual: Log list filtered successfully showing 100 General Exception results

steps.action: Select 'Search Indexer Exception' from the dropdown
steps.expected: Log list should filter to show Search Indexer Exceptions if any exist
steps.actual: Filter applied successfully. No Search Indexer Exceptions currently logged (empty result - expected behavior when no crawler errors have occurred)

steps.action: Click on a General Exception entry to expand details
steps.expected: Exception details should expand showing full information including stack trace
steps.actual: Exception details expanded successfully showing: AbsoluteURL, DefaultDataProvider, ExceptionGUID, PortalId, UserId, TabId, Message ('Thread was being aborted'), StackTrace, Source, and Server Name

steps.action: Click on 'Log Settings' tab in Admin Logs
steps.expected: Log Settings tab should display configurable log types with their status
steps.actual: Log Settings tab displayed showing all log types with columns: Log Type, Website, Active status, and File Name. Various exception types (General Exception, Scheduler Exception, etc.) shown as Active: True

observations: Code review shows SearchCrawlerException is a base exception class inheriting from System.Exception with no custom properties or methods
DirectoryIncludedException and DirectoryExcludedException inherit from SearchCrawlerException and provide localized error messages for directory-related crawling errors
These exception classes are internal to the Search Crawler module and would be logged when specific errors occur during crawling operations
No Search Crawler/Indexer exceptions are currently logged, which is expected - they only appear when actual crawling errors occur
The Event Viewer provides comprehensive exception logging infrastructure with filtering, detail viewing, and configuration capabilities
Exception types available for filtering include: General Exception, Search Indexer Exception, Scheduler Exception, Module Load Exception, Page Load Exception, Security Exception, and many others
